description: Excel 2016 Advanced explores ways to enhance Excel workbooks with topics in analyzing data, collaborating and workbook security, and adding graphical elements. This series covers important Excel functionality such as format as table, conditional formatting, shared workbooks and tracked changes, and data validation. While Excel 2016 Advanced is a continuation from the Excel 2016 Essentials series, it can be viewed as a standalone show for users looking to take their Excel skills to the next level.
descriptionMD: Excel 2016 Advanced explores ways to enhance Excel workbooks with topics in analyzing data, collaborating and workbook security, and adding graphical elements. This series covers important Excel functionality such as format as table, conditional formatting, shared workbooks and tracked changes, and data validation. While Excel 2016 Advanced is a continuation from the Excel 2016 Essentials series, it can be viewed as a standalone show for users looking to take their Excel skills to the next level.
name: Excel 2016 Advanced
subtitle: Spreadsheet application

episodes.description: Excel 2016 Advanced explores ways to enhance Excel workbooks with topics in analyzing data, collaborating and workbook security, and adding graphical elements. This series covers important Excel functionality such as format as table, conditional formatting, shared workbooks and tracked changes, and data validation. While Excel 2016 Advanced is a continuation from the Excel 2016 Essentials series, it can be viewed as a standalone show for users looking to take their Excel skills to the next level.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.810
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:05.810 --> 00:00:09.716
Hello, and
welcome to Excel 2016 Advanced Series.

3
00:00:09.716 --> 00:00:12.122
My name is Vonne Smith, and
in this course overview,

4
00:00:12.122 --> 00:00:14.960
well we're gonna be talking about
what is this show all about?

5
00:00:14.960 --> 00:00:16.832
Who is our target audience?

6
00:00:16.832 --> 00:00:19.505
Do we need to know anything
before we get started?

7
00:00:19.505 --> 00:00:22.191
And any extra tidbits I might have for
you.

8
00:00:22.191 --> 00:00:24.226
So, what are we gonna talk about?

9
00:00:24.226 --> 00:00:27.795
This show is broken up
into four specific areas.

10
00:00:27.795 --> 00:00:31.923
We have analyze data, graphical elements,
collaborate and security, and

11
00:00:31.923 --> 00:00:33.073
additional topics.

12
00:00:33.073 --> 00:00:38.221
In the Analyze Data section we're going
to be covering things like sorting and

13
00:00:38.221 --> 00:00:39.869
filtering out our data.

14
00:00:39.869 --> 00:00:43.374
We're also gonna be formatting in tables,
one of my favorite subjects.

15
00:00:43.374 --> 00:00:46.384
We'll also explore
the world of outlining and

16
00:00:46.384 --> 00:00:49.325
creating subtotals within our worksheets.

17
00:00:49.325 --> 00:00:54.602
We'll also be applying conditional
formatting, formatting that goes ahead and

18
00:00:54.602 --> 00:00:58.892
applies to specific criteria that
you instill and you make a rule.

19
00:00:58.892 --> 00:01:02.700
Very powerful stuff and a lot of different
things that you can use to kinda

20
00:01:02.700 --> 00:01:05.267
just see what is that
information saying to you.

21
00:01:05.267 --> 00:01:07.933
How are we going to be analyzing our data.

22
00:01:07.933 --> 00:01:09.184
Graphical elements,

23
00:01:09.184 --> 00:01:13.603
well that's where we get into some of my
other favorite areas of adding images.

24
00:01:13.603 --> 00:01:15.982
We'll be adding in
wonderful pictures of Mr.

25
00:01:15.982 --> 00:01:19.890
Fuego and Bishop, the stars of our
show at Christmas Cats, Incorporated.

26
00:01:19.890 --> 00:01:22.481
We'll also be adding in
some different shapes and

27
00:01:22.481 --> 00:01:24.772
how to format that will fills and
outlines.

28
00:01:24.772 --> 00:01:27.079
We'll also add in SmartArt.

29
00:01:27.079 --> 00:01:27.892
What is that?

30
00:01:27.892 --> 00:01:29.067
It's art that's smart.

31
00:01:29.067 --> 00:01:34.448
Really, it is and it's a lot of fun and
really easy to use, in Excel.

32
00:01:34.448 --> 00:01:37.693
So, we'll be exploring those
different elements that you might

33
00:01:37.693 --> 00:01:41.006
want to add in to your workbooks,
just add a little bit of pizzazz.

34
00:01:41.006 --> 00:01:45.723
Now, is Excel the place where you're gonna
be doing an extensive amount of formatting

35
00:01:45.723 --> 00:01:47.088

36

Maybe not, but everybody has different
reasons for why they want to use Excel.

37
00:01:50.958 --> 00:01:55.672
So we will definitely be covering
that area within this series.

38
00:01:55.672 --> 00:01:59.247
We'll also be talking about
how to share workbooks, and

39
00:01:59.247 --> 00:02:03.428
how to track changes in that,
Collaborate and Security section.

40
00:02:03.428 --> 00:02:07.266
We'll also go over an important
topic called Data Validation.

41
00:02:07.266 --> 00:02:12.219
Making sure that people are inputting
in the information into your cells that

42
00:02:12.219 --> 00:02:13.368
you want them to.

43
00:02:13.368 --> 00:02:17.365
And if they're not, let's go ahead and
throw them that little warning error to

44
00:02:17.365 --> 00:02:19.873
try to make sure that you
validate the information

45
00:02:19.873 --> 00:02:23.770
that's going into that with some certain
rules and locking some areas down.

46
00:02:23.770 --> 00:02:27.585
Speaking of locking down areas,
we're going to explore the world of

47
00:02:27.585 --> 00:02:31.741
locking cells and being able to protect
our worksheets and our workbooks.

48
00:02:31.741 --> 00:02:35.537
And then we'll also explore how
to pass protect our files and

49
00:02:35.537 --> 00:02:39.335
then also get into the document
properties that includes how

50
00:02:39.335 --> 00:02:42.398
to add those different properties or
metadata.

51
00:02:42.398 --> 00:02:46.636
Also inspect our document for hidden
information and how to get rid of that.

52
00:02:46.636 --> 00:02:50.103
And also explore the world

53
00:02:50.103 --> 00:02:55.485
making sure that our files are accessable

54
00:02:55.485 --> 00:02:56.930
We also have our additional topics area.

55

So we were gonna just throw in some little
tidbits like customizing our environments,

56
00:03:01.271 --> 00:03:04.185
some macros and some other
things that we will hopefully be

57
00:03:04.185 --> 00:03:07.395
using as an error to throw things
in there, just as important but

58
00:03:07.395 --> 00:03:09.487
maybe not fall in to a specific category.

59
00:03:09.487 --> 00:03:12.371
And we'll be hopefully
building that as we go.

60
00:03:12.371 --> 00:03:14.510
So who is this for?

61
00:03:14.510 --> 00:03:16.130
All Office users.

62
00:03:16.130 --> 00:03:21.069
Now as you see, Office is with a capital
O, and that's not meaning that you have

63
00:03:21.069 --> 00:03:24.831

64
00:03:24.831 --> 00:03:26.701
it can be in your home office.

65

Really, it's Office as the products,

to where you are using Excel as part

67

Maybe you're using Word and

So anybody that wants to go ahead and

it is a little bit higher

70

And that's why I put intermediate

71
00:03:50.432 --> 00:03:55.337
So where these series does work
upon the Excel Essentials series,

so we will be referring back to that.

So if you haven't watch some of

you might wanna gonna go ahead and

75

But this is also used as a stand-alone
series, where is you have some of

76

that foundational knowledge, then
you'll be able to excel in this series.

77
00:04:14.516 --> 00:04:17.035
And talking about that in a Prerequisites,

78
00:04:17.035 --> 00:04:21.198
right there we were talking about

79

And then also having
a familiarity with other Office

81

If you know how to insert images in Word

83

A lot of that same functionality goes

84

For example the episode that we talked

it's pretty much the same thing

86
00:04:44.102 --> 00:04:48.429
any of those other series that you may
have watch that exact same episode.

87
00:04:48.429 --> 00:04:50.428
Well it's the same thing in Excel.

88

So having a little bit of that knowledge
and other places will be helpful.

89
00:04:54.324 --> 00:04:59.076
And of course just knowing about how work

90

is always a good thing to know about for
these different shows.

91
00:05:02.905 --> 00:05:06.763
So some little tidbits
that I can give to you.

92
00:05:06.763 --> 00:05:10.420
There is always more than one
way to do something in Excel.

93
00:05:10.420 --> 00:05:12.876
I might cover ways one, two and three.

94
00:05:12.876 --> 00:05:16.181
But maybe there's a fourth and
a fifth way, that I didn't cover.

95
00:05:16.181 --> 00:05:19.877
Well, there's a lot of information to
cover just kinda getting the basics

96
00:05:19.877 --> 00:05:20.413
on there.

97
00:05:20.413 --> 00:05:25.420
So it is very possible that there is
some other way to do it and that's okay.

98
00:05:25.420 --> 00:05:27.174
So, and updates will happen,

99
00:05:27.174 --> 00:05:31.424
maybe I'm showing you something in
these episodes that you're like hmm,

100
00:05:31.424 --> 00:05:35.892
I don't have that button or like maybe
my button looks a little bit different.

101
00:05:35.892 --> 00:05:43.214
That happens to your products, because
I am using an Office 365 subscription.

102
00:05:43.214 --> 00:05:47.647
If you're not on a subscription base,
that's where things might look a little

103

different there, because there are certain
elements that are only available for

104
00:05:52.213 --> 00:05:53.884
Office 365 subscribers.

105
00:05:53.884 --> 00:05:57.611
Just one other note on that
particular subject is that we

106
00:05:57.611 --> 00:06:01.912
have different levels of
subscriptions in your Office 365.

107
00:06:01.912 --> 00:06:04.522
So if you're not on
an Enterprise license and

108
00:06:04.522 --> 00:06:08.727
you're on a Home license there could
be some slight variations, okay?

109
00:06:08.727 --> 00:06:10.229
That's just the nature of these products.

110
00:06:10.229 --> 00:06:15.394
So again I might be covering something
that you might not even have access to and

111
00:06:15.394 --> 00:06:18.067
it could be the version of your product.

112
00:06:18.067 --> 00:06:22.291
Another thing, always consult the Oracle,
searching for answers.

113
00:06:22.291 --> 00:06:26.961
There is so many different facets to these
programs that we can't cover every single

114
00:06:26.961 --> 00:06:31.580
detail in this episodes, we'll try but
there is always something more out there.

115
00:06:31.580 --> 00:06:36.764
And so consulting Google or Bing or
any search engine that you prefer to use,

116
00:06:36.764 --> 00:06:41.143
it will always go ahead and
help to just kind of find the answers.

117
00:06:41.143 --> 00:06:45.290
Think sometimes how you can say
what you are wanting to do,

118
00:06:45.290 --> 00:06:48.006
that's sometimes the hardest part.

119
00:06:48.006 --> 00:06:51.744
So try to just try keep searching out
there and see what you can find and

120
00:06:51.744 --> 00:06:56.215
everybody uses Excel differently just like
I have said in the graphical element.

121
00:06:56.215 --> 00:06:58.981
Now is this a program that
you want to go ahead and

122
00:06:58.981 --> 00:07:01.345
make invitation to a birthday party in?

123
00:07:01.345 --> 00:07:02.380
Well, you could,

124
00:07:02.380 --> 00:07:06.405
there's nothing that says you can't
use Excel to create an invitation.

125
00:07:06.405 --> 00:07:10.787
But maybe some other products like Word,
that's where you might want to do that.

126
00:07:10.787 --> 00:07:14.428
But again, everybody has a different
reason for using these products.

127
00:07:14.428 --> 00:07:17.092
Maybe all you do is sort and
filter data, so

128
00:07:17.092 --> 00:07:21.014
that's gonna be an area that
you're really going to focus on.

129
00:07:21.014 --> 00:07:23.737
Or maybe you really wanna use
a conditional formatting, or

130
00:07:23.737 --> 00:07:26.308
you might not have any use for
conditional formatting.

131
00:07:26.308 --> 00:07:30.223
But just knowing that the product can do
it, you never know down the road when

132
00:07:30.223 --> 00:07:34.219
you're going to be able to use some of
these things, and say, you know what?

133
00:07:34.219 --> 00:07:36.445
I know that Excel can do that,
and then you can come back and

134
00:07:36.445 --> 00:07:37.364
watch these episodes.

135
00:07:37.364 --> 00:07:40.508
And of course always have fun,
I try to have fun,

136
00:07:40.508 --> 00:07:43.654
I always try to keep it light and
entertaining and

137
00:07:43.654 --> 00:07:48.505
hopefully to be able to make you using
Excel be a little bit more enjoyable.

138
00:07:48.505 --> 00:07:52.271
I know it can get really frustrating from
time to time when it's not working the way

139
00:07:52.271 --> 00:07:52.882
you want to.

140
00:07:52.882 --> 00:07:56.893
But sometimes it's kinda let's see
if I can make everything pink and

141
00:07:56.893 --> 00:07:59.184
it will make everything a lot more fun.

142
00:07:59.184 --> 00:08:02.296
So I hope you enjoyed these episodes and
I hope to see you really soon.

143
00:08:02.296 --> 00:08:09.309
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate how to analyze data using sort and filter functions in Excel 2016. Sorting changes the order of all your data either by date, price, or alphabetically. Filter shows data based on your criteria. They also explore more advanced techniques with custom sorts and custom filters.
episodes.title: Sort and Filter

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne will explore conditional formatting which allows you to automatically apply formats to a cell or range of cells based on cell values. They demonstrate the different types of rules and how to customize formatting.
episodes.title: Conditional Formatting

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore using outline and subtotals in Excel 2016. Here you will learn how to work with outlines to create collapsible groups of rows and columns to show/hide your data as well as add calculated subtotals to properly sorted ranges.
episodes.title: Outline and Subtotals

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne examine working with data formatted as tables in Excel 2016. Here they will cover table formatting options, adding/deleting table rows/columns, adding a total row, removing duplicates, and converting to a range.
episodes.title: Tables

episodes.description: Vonne and Zach cover data tables, part of the What-If Analysis tools. Data tables can show different results of formulas by changing up to two variables.
episodes.title: Data Tables

episodes.description: Vonne and Zach discuss combining and summarizing data using the consolidate command. This can be used within a single worksheet or across multiple worksheets and/or workbooks.
episodes.title: Consolidate Data

episodes.description: Vonne and Zach examine scenarios in the What-If Analysis commands. Scenarios allow you to set up and save different values in cells and see how they can create different results in your formulas.
episodes.title: Scenarios

episodes.description: Vonne and Zach cover the last item in the What-If Analysis tool group - goal seek. Goal seek is used when you know the desired result of your formulas, but want to experiment with cell values to achieve that result.
episodes.title: Goal Seek

episodes.description: Vonne and Zach discuss how to remove duplicate data in three different ways:  using the remove duplicate command, conditional formatting, and advanced filters.
episodes.title: Remove Duplicates

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Zach take a deeper dive into advanced filter options.
episodes.title: Advanced Filter

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne show you how to add a graphical element to your Excel 2016 spreadsheets. Here they will demonstrate inserting graphics from a file or online, as well as resizing, rotating, aligning, moving, and cropping your images.
episodes.title: Image: Basics

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne dive deeper into working with graphics inside of Excel 2016. Here they will show you how to manipulate images by adding borders, effects, change picture styles, reset pictures, perform image corrections, add artistic effects, and add alternate text titles and descriptions for accessibility.
episodes.title: Images: Format

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne look at inserting and formatting shapes in Excel 2016. They demonstrate how to manipulate shapes by resizing, rotating, filling with gradients/colors, connecting shapes with lines, adding text, and editing their points.
episodes.title: Shapes: Add and Format

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne continue working with shapes in Excel 2016, this time working with multiple shapes as well as icons. Here you will see how to select multiple shapes, duplicate, rotate, align, change stacking order, group/ungroup, and use the selection pane.
episodes.title: Shapes: Multiple Shapes and Icons

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore using SmartArt in Excel 2016. Here they will show you how to use SmartArt to more easily add a graphical element to your spreadsheets by giving you self-adjusting themes, text, and shapes.
episodes.title: Smart Art

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne culminate our graphical element skills in Excel 2016 by creating a birthday invitation. Here you will see how to use page layouts, orientation, formatting text, moving cells, inserting images, grouping images, etc. Then they show you how to create a two-sided invitation, printing, marking paper for orientation, and adjusting element placement for printer adjustment.
episodes.title: Create an Invitation

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne will explore shared workbooks in Excel 2016. Here they cover the why and how of sharing workbooks as well as showing you what to expect when working with shared workbooks. They also look at sharing through OneDrive for online collaboration.
episodes.title: Shared Workbooks

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne dive into track changes in Excel 2016. Here they will explain why you would want to enable tracking and how to accomplish that. They also take you through the tracking experience to help you understand how this may benefit you in your working environment.
episodes.title: Track Changes

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore implementing data validation inside of Excel 2016. Here they will show you how to prevent erroneous data types from being entered by restricting the type of data that a user can insert. They also show you how to create custom error messages, highlight invalid data, and protect worksheets with a password.
episodes.title: Data Validation

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne dive into workbook security in Excel 2016. Here they will show you security features like protecting workbooks and worksheets, restrict to editing  certain ranges, mark as final, encrypt file with password, restricting access, and digital signatures.
episodes.title: Workbook Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore working with document properties of an Excel 2016 workbook. Here they will discuss the different properties and metadata as well as demonstrate how to edit and add properties
episodes.title: Document Properties

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate how you can customize the Excel 2016 interface to make it more efficient for your workflow. Here you will see how to customize the Ribbon, make custom keyboard shortcuts, and other options in Excel that can be manipulated for ease of use.
episodes.title: Customize Interface
